channel.title: DDoS Defense
channel.description:
Interesting read I stumbled upon..
"How to [b]defend[/b] against a DDoS attack [pdf]"
[url=http://www.secure.edu.pl/pdf/2013/D1_1530_A_Graham-Cumming.pdf]http://www.secure.edu.pl/pdf/2013/D1_1530_A_Graham-Cumming.pdf[/url]
Also more info from the site I found this on: [url=https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=6612641]https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=6612641[/url]

item.title: DDoS Defense
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Kaibutzu:

google is working on a DDOS shield

Yes, but that’s for websites accessed via HTTP (websites that are political in nature). Their DDoS mitigation service is about ensuring freedom of speech.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoS Defense
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

They would have to go through the process of setting up teredo (or a similar technology) for it to work. But if that setup was used, and it was simplified enough for players, then DDoS attacks would likely stop being a problem in this community.

Read full topic

item.title: DDoS Defense
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Though few would be able to connect from residential ISPs. I want to say I was successful in making the server and client work strictly over IPv6 but the tunnel I was using gave me some problems when trying to connect externally. Had it working with ::1 localhost though. Wasn’t worth keeping as few could connect with ISPs that are still in the dark ages cough TimeWarner cough

Read full topic

item.title: DDoS Defense
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:2, topic:534684”]in summary:
hide yo backend and have beefy edge servers[/quote]
Pretty much. There are plenty of strategies but, at the end of the day, they’re only partially effective. Apparently existing booter services don’t do IPv6, so running an IPv6 server would help.

Read full topic
